introduction.title: Welcome to myBikeLog
introduction.description: Discover the vision behind your new virtual mechanic.
introduction.content:
Welcome to myBikeLog.

MyBikeLog is not just a logbook: it is a digital engineering ecosystem designed for cyclists who demand perfection.

Our mission is to transform maintenance from an occasional chore into an exact science. We believe that every watt saved thanks to a clean chain or a smooth bearing is a victory.

With myBikeLog, you don't just track kilometers: you monitor the vital health status of your vehicle, preventing breakdowns and optimizing performance. Whether you are an amateur or a professional, this platform is your personal chief mechanic, always active, always precise.

connecting_strava.title: Connecting Strava
connecting_strava.description: Automatically import your bikes and synchronize kilometers.
connecting_strava.content:
Strava integration is the beating heart of myBikeLog. It keeps component mileages updated without any manual entry.

How to do it:

  1. Go to Settings from the side menu.
  2. Scroll to the Strava Integration section.
  3. Click on Connect Strava.
  4. You will be redirected to the Strava website to authorize myBikeLog.
  5. Once authorized, you will be taken back here and automatic synchronization will begin.

Note: We only import bike data (Gear) and activities to update mileage. We do not post anything on your behalf.

adding_bike.title: Adding a Bike
adding_bike.content:
If you don't use Strava or want to manage an extra bike, you can add it manually.

  1. Go to the My Bikes section.
  2. Click the + Add Bike button.
  3. Enter Brand, Model, and initial mileage (if not new).
  4. Choose an icon and a color to recognize it at a glance.

managing_components.title: Component Management
managing_components.content:
For each bike, you can define a list of components (Chain, Brakes, Tires, etc.).

For each component, set a Wear Threshold (e.g., 3000 km for a chain). myBikeLog will notify you when you approach that limit.
